dct_title_s: Bosques y comunidades : vertiente del Pacífico Panamá-Colombia-Ecuador-Perú / coordinación: Instituto del Bien Común.
dct_description_sm: Relief shown by shading. Title from panel. Includes text. legends, graphs, and source information. The map shows protected forest areas administered by national or regional institutions in the South American Neotropical Pacific Slope coastal corridor,known as "Chocó Biogeográfico". It focuses on the pressures these ecosystems face due to the exploitation of natural resources and other human activities, such as agro-industrial production; it highlights the location of conservation units, land ecoregions, roads, and rivers. Locates indigenous and Afrodescendant communities.
dct_publisher_sm: Lima, Perú : Instituto del Bien Común, 2013.
Lima: Ecociencia. Instituto del Bien Común, 2013.
dct_subject_sm: Petroleum industry and trade—Environmental aspects—South America—Maps
dcat_theme_sm: Petroleum industry and trade—Environmental aspects—South America—Maps
